title: UniversalConstraint
content:
This file is automatically generated. Please don't edit it manually.

name: UniversalConstraint
type: class
memorycategory: BaseParts
summary: |
  Ensures two axes on two bodies remain perpendicular.
description: |
  A UniversalConstraint ensures two axes on two bodies remain perpendicular.
  Contextually, this constraint is more restrictive than a
  Class.BallSocketConstraint but less restrictive than a
  Class.HingeConstraint by one degree of freedom.

  Example applications of this constraint include transmitting power between the
  transmission and drive shafts of cars, robotics, and more.

  When configuring this constraint, it may be helpful to study
  Roblox Units to understand how Roblox units
  compare to metric units.

  #### Limits

  Enabling the Class.UniversalConstraint.LimitsEnabled|LimitsEnabled property
  exposes the Class.UniversalConstraint.MaxAngle|MaxAngle limit to restrict
  tilt within a cone, as well as
  Class.UniversalConstraint.Restitution|Restitution which defines the
  elasticity of the attachments when they reach the limit.
codesamples: []
inherits:
  - Constraint
descendants: []
tags: []
deprecationmessage: ''
properties:
  - name: UniversalConstraint.LimitsEnabled
    summary: |
      Determines whether the angular motion of attachments' primary axes is
      limited.
    description: |
      This property, when enabled, limits the relative angular motion of the
      primary axes of attachments through a cone constraint. The default value
      is false.
    codesamples: []
    type: boolean
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Universal
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Physics
  - name: UniversalConstraint.MaxAngle
    summary: |
      The max angle, in degrees, of the constraint's limiting cone.
    description: |
      This property determines the max angle, in degrees, of the constraint's
      limiting cone, formed from Class.Constraint.Attachment0|Attachment0 and
      its primary axis. The default value is 45 degrees.

      In order for this property to take affect, the constraint's
      Class.UniversalConstraint.LimitsEnabled|LimitsEnabled property must be
      set to true.
    codesamples: []
    type: float
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Limits
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Physics
  - name: UniversalConstraint.Radius
    summary: |
      The constraint's visualization radius.
    description: |
      This property indicates the constraint's visualization radius, in studs.
      Default value is 0.2.
    codesamples: []
    type: float
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Appearance
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Physics
  - name: UniversalConstraint.Restitution
    summary: |
      The restitution coefficient of the cone constraint.
    description: |
      This property determines the restitution of the two
      Class.Attachment|Attachments connected by the
      Class.UniversalConstraint when they reach the end of the range specified
      by Class.UniversalConstraint.MaxAngle|MaxAngle. The value defaults to 0
      and can be any floating number in the range of 0 to 1. Only applies when
      Class.UniversalConstraint.LimitsEnabled|LimitsEnabled is set to true.
    codesamples: []
    type: float
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Limits
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Physics
